description: Largely known for the Ashwell hoard, the site is a complex not only including a temple, but also a shrine enclosing a springhead, accommodation, and workshops. There are other nearby temple sites at Barkway and Aston.
bibliography: Jackson, R., Burleigh, G., (2018), Dea Senuna: Treasure, Cult and Ritual at Ashwell, Hertfordshire, British Museum
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, et al, (2015), Ashwell, near Baldock (Hertfordshire), available at: https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449
Richardson, I., (2012), PAS-9708E3: A ROMAN HOARD, available at: https://finds.org.uk/database/artefacts/record/id/509533#1
Jackson, R., Burleigh, G., (2007), The Senuna treasure and shrine at Ashwell (Herts), in Continuity and Innovation in Religion in the Roman West, 1, pg. 37-54
